Title:
Monophyly and interrelationships of the Centromochlinae
(Siluriformes: Auchenipteridae).
Abstract:
The subfamily Centromochlinae, with more than 30 species
in three genera, is recognized as monophyletic, and redefined based on
synapomorphies. The status of the group and a revision of characters
previously proposed in literature are discussed. The genera Glanidium,
Tatia, and Centromochlus are defined as monophyletic units. Glanidium,
with six species, is identified as the sister group of a clade formed by
the other two genera. Tatia, known as a paraphyletic assemblage of 17
species by previous authors, is herein restricted to eight species and
recognized as the sister group of Centromochlus. Centromochlus,
previously consisting of two easily distinguished forms, is expanded to
include nine species. Gelanoglanis is placed as a junior synonym of
Centromochlus. Based on the given synapomorphies for each group,
diagnoses are proposed for Glanidium, Tatia, and Centromochlus.
